gov.sandia.cognition.graph

Interface DirectedNodeEdgeGraph<NodeNameType>

  • Type Parameters:
    NodeNameType -
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DirectedWeightedNodeEdgeGraph<NodeNameType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DenseMemoryGraph, WeightedDenseMemoryGraph

    public interface DirectedNodeEdgeGraph<NodeNameType>
    This interface defines the minimal set of methods necessary to create and walk a directed graph.
    Author:
    jdwendt

    • Method Summary

      Adds a directed edge from left to right.

      Returns whether or not the graph contains the specified vertex.

      Return the edge endpoints (by node id) for edge id (where id [0 ...
      NodeNameType getNode(int id)
      Returns the node label for the input id.
      int getNodeId(NodeNameType node)
      Returns the integer ID of the input node.

      Returns all of the nodes contained in the graph.

      Return the number of edges.
      int getNumNodes()
      Return the number of nodes

    • Method Detail

      • getNodes

        java.util.Collection<NodeNameType> getNodes()
        Returns all of the nodes contained in the graph.
        Returns:
        all of the nodes in the graph

      • getNumNodes

        int getNumNodes()
        Return the number of nodes
        Returns:
        the number of nodes

      • getNumEdges

        int getNumEdges()
        Return the number of edges.
        Returns:
        the number of edges

      • addEdge

        void addEdge(NodeNameType left,
             NodeNameType right)
        Adds a directed edge from left to right. If left and right are not already in the graph, they are added before the edge is added.
        Parameters:
        left - The source of the edge
        right - The destination of the edge

      • addNode

        void addNode(NodeNameType node)
        Adds the input node to the graph. Calling this method is unnecessary if the node participates in any edges. If you call addEdge(Object, Object), it handles adding new nodes.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to add to the graph

      • containsNode

        boolean containsNode(NodeNameType node)
        Returns whether or not the graph contains the specified vertex.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to check for
        Returns:
        true if this contains node

      • getSuccessors

        java.util.Collection<NodeNameType> getSuccessors(NodeNameType node)
        Returns all the nodes this node connects to (outgoing edges only).
        Parameters:
        node - The node whose successors are requested
        Returns:
        all the nodes this node connects to.

      • getEdgeEndpointIds

        Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> getEdgeEndpointIds(int id)
        Return the edge endpoints (by node id) for edge id (where id [0 ... numEdges()).
        Parameters:
        id - The edge id
        Returns:
        The node id pair for the source and destination of an edge (use getNode(int) to determine which nodes these are (if you care)).

      • getNode

        NodeNameType getNode(int id)
        Returns the node label for the input id. To be used in conjunction with getEdgeEndpointIds(int). If you pass in a bad id, an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        id - The node id
        Returns:
        The node label for the input id

      • getNodeId

        int getNodeId(NodeNameType node)
        Returns the integer ID of the input node. To be used in conjunction with getEdgeEndpointIds(int).
        Parameters:
        node - The node value
        Returns:
        The index for the node as stored internally

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears the graph back to the original, empty state
